services_offered.a: Full-stack design and development, design systems, user research, product strategy, and technical consulting. I work across the entire product development lifecycle from concept to launch.

services_offered.q: Do you do just design or also development?
services_offered.a: Both. I'm a design engineer who can take projects from concept through implementation. This integrated approach ensures designs are technically feasible and delivered as intended.

services_offered.q: What kind of design systems work do you do?
services_offered.a: I build design systems from scratch, audit and improve existing systems, and create governance frameworks. My focus is on adoption and real-world usage, not just documentation.

services_offered.q: Do you offer user research services?
services_offered.a: Yes, I conduct user interviews, usability testing, competitive analysis, and behavioral research. I adapt methods to cultural context and organizational constraints.

services_offered.q: What's included in your product strategy work?
services_offered.a: Market analysis, user needs assessment, feature prioritization, roadmap planning, and competitive positioning. I help align product direction with user needs and business objectives.

services_offered.q: Do you help with technical architecture?
services_offered.a: Yes, I advise on technology choices, system architecture, and implementation approaches. My development background helps me design systems that are both user-friendly and technically sound.

services_offered.q: Can you help with existing products or just new ones?
services_offered.a: Both. I've improved existing products (like the Fresha redesign) and built new ones from scratch (like GoDesk). Each requires different approaches but similar systematic thinking.

services_offered.q: Do you work with design teams or independently?
services_offered.a: Both. I can work as an embedded team member, lead design initiatives, or work independently as needed. I adapt to whatever structure serves the project best.

project_types.q: What types of projects do you work on?
project_types.a: MVP development, design system creation, product redesigns, user research initiatives, and technical consulting. I prefer projects where design and technology intersect.

project_types.q: Do you work on mobile projects?
project_types.a: Yes, I design responsive web applications and have mobile development experience. I prefer progressive web apps over native apps unless there's a specific platform requirement.
I've worked on complex e-commerce systems like Games Workshop's Warhammer store. E-commerce requires understanding conversion optimization, inventory management, and payment flows.

project_types.q: Do you work on SaaS applications?
project_types.a: Yes, including platforms like Fresha and GoDesk. SaaS requires understanding user onboarding, feature adoption, and subscription business models.
I've designed enterprise tools for Shell and Jio. Enterprise software requires understanding complex workflows, permission systems, and organizational hierarchies.

project_types.q: Do you work on data visualization projects?
project_types.a: Yes, I create dashboards and data visualization tools. The key is making complex data accessible and actionable for the intended audience.
I've built ML-powered features at GoDesk and work with AI integration in various projects. The challenge is making AI feel helpful rather than unpredictable.

availability_timeline.q: Are you available for new projects?
availability_timeline.a: I'm currently available for Q4 2025. I take on one project at a time to ensure quality delivery and proper attention to each client.

availability_timeline.q: How long do projects usually take?
availability_timeline.a: Depends on scope and complexity. MVPs might take 6-12 weeks, design systems 3-6 months, full product redesigns 4-8 months. I provide detailed estimates after understanding requirements.

availability_timeline.q: Do you work on long-term contracts?
availability_timeline.a: Yes, I'm open to both project-based work and longer-term engagements. I've successfully worked on retainer arrangements and ongoing development partnerships.

availability_timeline.q: Can you work on urgent projects?
availability_timeline.a: Depends on current capacity and project scope. I prioritize quality over speed, but I can often accommodate urgent needs with clear scope definition.

availability_timeline.q: Do you offer maintenance and ongoing support?
availability_timeline.a: Yes, I provide ongoing support, updates, and iterations after project delivery. Long-term relationships often produce the best results.

availability_timeline.q: How do you handle project scheduling?
availability_timeline.a: Clear milestones, regular check-ins, and flexible scheduling that accommodates both my availability and client needs. Communication is key to successful project timing.

working_arrangements.a: Yes, I'm based in Madrid but work with clients globally. I'm experienced with remote collaboration tools and processes, and can also work onsite when needed.
Yes, when it adds value to the project. Some work benefits from face-to-face collaboration, especially during discovery phases or when building team relationships.

working_arrangements.q: What time zones do you work with?
working_arrangements.a: I've worked across European, Asian, and American time zones. I'm flexible with scheduling and good at finding overlap windows that work for everyone.

working_arrangements.q: How do you handle communication across time zones?
working_arrangements.a: Structured async communication, clear documentation, and strategic use of overlap time. I design workflows that don't require constant real-time collaboration.

working_arrangements.q: What tools do you use for remote collaboration?
working_arrangements.a: Figma for design collaboration, Slack for communication, Zoom for meetings, and whatever project management tools the team prefers. I adapt to client preferences.

working_arrangements.q: Do you integrate with existing teams?
working_arrangements.a: Yes, I integrate seamlessly with existing teams and processes. I adapt to your culture and workflows while bringing fresh perspectives and expertise.

pricing_business.q: How do you price your work?
pricing_business.a: Project-based pricing based on scope, timeline, and value delivered. I provide detailed proposals after understanding your specific needs and objectives.

pricing_business.q: Do you work on hourly or project rates?
pricing_business.a: I prefer project-based pricing for defined scopes, but I'm flexible based on client needs. Hourly rates work better for ongoing consultation or undefined scope work.

pricing_business.q: What information do you need for a quote?
pricing_business.a: I need to understand the problem you're solving, your target users, technical constraints, timeline, and budget range. The more context you provide, the more accurate and helpful I can be.

pricing_business.q: Do you require deposits or have payment terms?
pricing_business.a: Yes, I typically require a deposit to begin work with payment milestones tied to project phases. Terms are outlined clearly in project agreements.

pricing_business.q: Do you work with different budget ranges?
pricing_business.a: I work with various budget ranges and can often adjust scope to fit budget constraints. Clear budget discussion upfront helps align expectations and deliverables.

pricing_business.q: What's included in your project pricing?
pricing_business.a: Design work, development when applicable, documentation, training, and reasonable revisions. I clearly outline what's included vs. additional services in project proposals.

contact_process.q: How can I get in touch?
contact_process.a: You can reach me through the contact form on this site, or email me directly at abbottsayshi@gmail.com. I typically respond within 4 hours and am happy to discuss potential projects or collaborations.

contact_process.q: What's the best way to start a project with you?
contact_process.a: I believe in a candid and casual approach to business relationships. We can have a quick chat online or over the phone to see if there is a fit then go from there. Alternatively, if you're certain you want to work with me I'm happy to produce a proposal based on your requirements.
Yes, I offer initial consultations to discuss project feasibility, technology choices, and strategic direction. The first consultation is complimentary.
We'll have a conversation to understand your needs, I'll ask questions about your goals and constraints, then provide recommendations on approach and next steps.

contact_process.q: How detailed are your project proposals?
contact_process.a: Very detailed. I outline scope, timeline, deliverables, pricing, and assumptions. Clear proposals prevent misunderstandings and set projects up for success.
Yes, I'm happy to sign reasonable NDAs to discuss confidential projects. I understand the importance of protecting sensitive business information.

contact_process.q: What if we're not sure what we need?
contact_process.a: That's common and completely fine. I often start with discovery workshops to help clarify needs, define problems, and identify the best approach forward.

contact_process.q: How do you handle project changes?
contact_process.a: Change is normal in good projects. I build flexibility into timelines and have clear processes for handling scope changes with transparent impact assessment.

specific_scenarios.a: Yes, I love working with startups! Having co-founded GoDesk, I understand the unique challenges and constraints. I can help with everything from MVP design to scaling for growth.

specific_scenarios.q: Do you take on enterprise projects?
specific_scenarios.a: Absolutely. I have extensive experience with Fortune 500 companies and understand how to navigate complex stakeholder landscapes while delivering results at scale.

specific_scenarios.q: Can you help with design system implementation?
specific_scenarios.a: Yes, that's one of my specialties. I've built design systems from scratch at multiple companies and can help with implementation, adoption, and governance.

specific_scenarios.q: Do you help with hiring design teams?
specific_scenarios.a: I can advise on design team structure, hiring criteria, and interview processes. I've built and led design teams and understand what skills are needed at different stages.

specific_scenarios.q: Can you help with design audits?
specific_scenarios.a: Yes, I conduct comprehensive design audits covering usability, accessibility, technical implementation, and business alignment. Audits often reveal quick wins and long-term opportunities.

specific_scenarios.q: Do you offer design training or workshops?
specific_scenarios.a: I occasionally run workshops on design systems, cross-functional collaboration, and design thinking. I prefer small, intensive sessions working through real problems.
